title: Columbus Police: Father charged after 2-year-old son is shot at home
content:
COLUMBUS, Ohio -- Columbus Police said 2-year-old Jaeson Hill is at the hospital in life-threatening condition after being shot in southeast Columbus
The boy is believed to have got his hands on the gun and shot himself at his home according to police.
The father drove down the street and flagged down an officer in uniform in a parking lot at the corner of Refugee Road and Noe Bixby Road around 2:45 p.m. Wednesday said police.
Police said the officer called for medics and the child was taken to Nationwide Children's Hospital.
Police said the father was detained for questioning and it appears the gun was not secured at the family's home less than a mile from where the father got the attention of the officer.
The father, 34-year-old Brandon Hill, is now facing a felony charge of endangering children.
Police said the father was the only other person home at the time of the incident.
Hill was arraigned on Thursday and posted a $25,000 bond.
